hypothesis_content.title: DeFi 'Blue Chip' Mean Reversion on Liquidity Scare
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, a sharp, single-day sell-off in high-quality DeFi tokens (CRV, AAVE) exceeding -20% on news of a sector-specific liquidity scare (e.g., a major protocol exploit rumor) will be overdone and reverse 50% of the drop within 5 days, provided no systemic contagion occurs.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquid DeFi blue chips often see panic, liquidity-driven selling on isolated bad news. If the broader DeFi system and BTC are stable, this represents a localized liquidity vacuum that is quickly filled by value-seeking capital, leading to a sharp technical rebound.
entry_conditions: CRV or AAVE experiences a daily close down > -20%
The sell-off is attributed to a specific, non-systemic news headline (exploit, hack rumor)
Aggregate DeFi TVL (Total Value Locked) 1-day change is > -5% (no broad contagion)
BTC daily return is between -3% and +3% (idiosyncratic event)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price recovers 50% of the single-day loss (from close to close)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new 5-day low below the panic sell day's low

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The sell-off continues or the token fails to rebound significantly, indicating the news reflects a fundamental, lasting impairment (e.g., a real, massive exploit) or triggers broader sector contagion.
